nl: Let $R$ be a ring, with $M$ an ideal of $R$. Suppose that every element of $R$ which is not in $M$ is a unit of $R$. Prove that $M$ is a maximal ideal and that moreover it is the only maximal ideal of $R$.
lean:
∀ {R : Type*} [Ring R]
  (M : Ideal R) (hM : ∀ (x : R), x ∉ M → IsUnit x)
  (hProper : ∃ x : R, x ∉ M) :
  IsMaximal M ∧ ∀ (N, Ideal R), IsMaximal N → N = M
candidate: ∀ {R : Type*} [Ring R] (M : Ideal R) (hM : ∀ (x : R), x ∉ M → IsUnit x) : IsMaximal M ∧ ∀ (N, Ideal R), IsMaximal N → N = M
